013package org.apache.juneau.junit.bct;
014
015import java.util.*;
016
017/**
018 * Abstract interface for Bean-Centric Test (BCT) object conversion and property access.
019 *
020 * <p>This interface defines the core contract for converting objects to strings and lists,
021 * and for accessing object properties in a uniform way. It forms the foundation of the BCT
022 * testing framework, enabling consistent object introspection and value extraction across
023 * different object types and structures.</p>
024 *
025 * <h5 class='section'>Core Conversion Operations:</h5>
026 * <dl>
027 *    <dt><b>{@link #stringify(Object)}</b></dt>
028 *    <dd>Converts any object to its string representation, handling nested structures</dd>
029 *
030 *    <dt><b>{@link #listify(Object)}</b></dt>
031 *    <dd>Converts collection-like objects (arrays, Collections, Iterables, etc.) to List&lt;Object&gt;</dd>
032 *
033 *    <dt><b>{@link #swap(Object)}</b></dt>
034 *    <dd>Pre-processes objects before conversion (e.g., unwrapping Optional, calling Supplier)</dd>
035 *
036 *    <dt><b>{@link #getProperty(Object, String)}</b></dt>
037 *    <dd>Accesses object properties using multiple fallback mechanisms</dd>
038 * </dl>
039 *
040 * <h5 class='section'>Property Access Strategy:</h5>
041 * <p>The {@link #getProperty(Object, String)} method uses a comprehensive fallback approach:</p>
042 *
043 * <h5 class='section'>Usage in BCT Framework:</h5>
044 * <p>This interface is used internally by BCT assertion methods like:</p>
045 * <ul>
046 *    <li>{@link BctAssertions#assertBean(Object, String, String)}</li>
047 *    <li>{@link BctAssertions#assertMapped(Object, java.util.function.BiFunction, String, String)}</li>
048 *    <li>{@link BctAssertions#assertList(List, Object...)}</li>
049 *    <li>{@link BctAssertions#assertBeans(Collection, String, String...)}</li>
050 * </ul>
051 *
052 * @see BasicBeanConverter
053 * @see BctAssertions
054 */
055public interface BeanConverter {
056
057   /**
058    * Converts an object to its string representation for testing purposes.
059    *
060    * @param o The object to stringify
061    * @return The string representation of the object
062    */
063   String stringify(Object o);
064
065   /**
066    * Converts a collection-like object to a standardized List&lt;Object&gt; format.
067    *
068    * @param o The object to convert to a list. Must not be null.
069    * @return A List containing the elements
070    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the object is null or cannot be converted to a list
071    */
072   List<Object> listify(Object o);
073
074   /**
075    * Determines if an object can be converted to a list.
076    *
077    * @param o The object to test. May be null.
078    * @return True if the object can be listified, false if null or cannot be listified
079    */
080   boolean canListify(Object o);
081
082   /**
083    * Pre-processes objects before conversion operations.
084    *
085    * @param o The object to swap
086    * @return The swapped object, or the original object if no swapping is needed
087    */
088   Object swap(Object o);
089
090   /**
091    * Accesses a named property or field from an object.
092    *
093    * @param object The object to access properties from
094    * @param name The property/field name to access
095    * @return The property value
096    * @throws RuntimeException if the property cannot be found or accessed
097    */
098   Object getProperty(Object object, String name);
099
100   /**
101    * Retrieves a configuration setting value with a fallback default.
102    *
103    * @param <T> The type of the setting value
104    * @param key The setting key to retrieve
105    * @param defaultValue The value to return if the setting is not found
106    * @return The setting value if found, otherwise the default value
107    */
108   <T> T getSetting(String key, T defaultValue);
109
110   /**
111    * Extracts a nested property value using structured field access syntax.
112    *
113    * @param o The object to extract nested properties from. May be null.
114    * @param token The parsed token containing the property access structure. Must not be null.
115    * @return A formatted string representation of the extracted nested values
116    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the token is null
117    */
118   String getNested(Object o, NestedTokenizer.Token token);
119}
